thread.title: Lauren Graham Is Returning to Television for the First Time Since Parenthood
thread.title_full: Lauren Graham Is Returning to Television for the First Time Since Parenthood

title: Lauren Graham Is Returning to Television for the First Time Since Parenthood
text:
Lauren Graham Is Returning to Television for the First Time Since Parenthood By Facebook PHOTO: Jason LaVeris/Getty Images 
Fans of Gilmore Girls and Parenthood , we've got great news for you: Lauren Graham is returning to television. The actress will be starring in the new Fox comedy pilot, Linda From HR â€”as, you guessed it, Linda. 
The title character is, obviously, a human resources employee whose "one bad decision throws her monotonous, unfulfilled life into an exciting but dangerous tailspin of balancing work life, home life, and a secret that could unravel everything," according to EW . 
Graham has quite extensive experience playing characters who need to wear multiple hats: Her character on Gilmore Girls , cool mom Lorelai Gilmore, balances running her own inn, appeasing her overbearing parents, raising her precocious daughter Rory, maintaining her relationship with beloved cafe-owner Luke, and dealing with all the town hall meetings that come with the territory of living in Stars Hollow. And as Sarah Braverman on NBC's Parenthood , Graham worked again to manage being a single, working, dating mother. Basically, the actress has "character with superhuman ability to juggle anything life throws her way" down. 
Linda From HR will be Lauren Graham's first full-time television role since NBC's Parenthood ended its six-season run in 2015. She most recently reprised her beloved role as Lorelai Gilmore in the Netflix revival of Gilmore Girls , A Year in the Life .
